name: Baked Hot Chocolate Doughnuts
description: These easy baked doughnuts are best enjoyed with a sweet mug of hot chocolate. The perfect way to warm up this winter.

recipe_ingredient.note: 1/2 cup real maple syrup, or honey
recipe_ingredient.display: 1/2 cup real maple syrup, or honey

recipe_ingredient.note: 1/2 cup canned coconut milk (or milk of choice)
recipe_ingredient.display: 1/2 cup canned coconut milk (or milk of choice)

recipe_ingredient.note: 1/3 cup pumpkin puree (plain Greek yogurt or applesauce also work great) )
recipe_ingredient.display: 1/3 cup pumpkin puree (plain Greek yogurt or applesauce also work great) )

recipe_ingredient.note: 1 cup + 2 tablespoons whole wheat pastry flour (or all-purpose flour)
recipe_ingredient.display: 1 cup + 2 tablespoons whole wheat pastry flour (or all-purpose flour)

recipe_ingredient.note: 1/2 cup semi-sweet or dark chocolate chips
recipe_ingredient.display: 1/2 cup semi-sweet or dark chocolate chips

recipe_ingredient.note: 1/3 cup canned full fat coconut milk (heavy cream/whole milk) )
recipe_ingredient.display: 1/3 cup canned full fat coconut milk (heavy cream/whole milk) )

recipe_instructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350Â° F. Grease a 6-cup doughnut pan or 12-cup muffin pan with butter or melted coconut oil.

In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the coconut oil, maple syrup, milk, pumpkin, eggs, vanilla, and almond extract (if using) until combined. Add the whole wheat flour, flour, baking powder, and salt, mixing until just combined.

Spoon the batter into a zip top bag and snip the corner off. Pipe the batter into each donut cup, filling 1/2-2/3 the way full. Bake 12-15 minutes, until the tops are set. Remove and let cool 5 minutes, then run a knife around the edges to release, invert the doughnuts onto a cooling rack. Repeat with the remaining batter. If using a muffin pan, fill 2/3 the way full and bake 12-15 minutes.

To make the hot chocolate glaze. Combine chocolate chips and coconut milk in a microwave-safe bowl. Microwave, stirring every 45 seconds, until melted. Stir in the vanilla and coffee powder. Let cool 5 minutes.
Dip or drizzle the doughnuts in the glaze. Top with chocolate shavings, if desired. Highly recommend eating a few warm...with a rather large mug of hot cocoa :)
